title: 3rd suspect arrested in barber shop shooting of father, son
content:
WASHINGTON (AP) — Authorities have arrested the third and final suspect after a shooting inside a Washington barber shop left a man and his 2-year-old son wounded.
The Washington Post reports that 25-year-old Anthony Chambers of Southeast Washington was charged Friday with assault with a dangerous weapon.
Two other suspects, 21-year-old Terrance Atchison and 27-year-old Barry Bloomfield, have already been arrested and face the same charge in connection with the Feb. 12 shooting in a crowded barber shop in Northwest Washington near the Navy Yard.
The two victims have since been released from local hospitals.
In an affidavit, police say they believe the wounded man was responsible for the May shooting of one of the suspect's brothers.
It unclear whether the suspects have attorneys.
___
Information from: The Washington Post
